intro: Cyanocephalus digitatus, commonly known as the blue-headed cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and blue-gray foliage. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It is adapted to arid environments, with spines that provide protection and reduce water loss. Cyanocephalus digitatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
